symptoms.name: Rash
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to florid and disseminated
symptoms.pattern: Papulopustular, vesiculopustular, or purpuric eruptions; localized or disseminated; can be painless and non-pruritic; may resolve with desquamation

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.severity: Variable, common in some studies, absent in others
symptoms.pattern: Present in a majority of cases in some studies, absent in others

vital_signs.blood_pressure: Can be low in severe cases (e.g., 80/50 mmHg)
vital_signs.respiratory_rate: Can be elevated in severe cases (e.g., 38/min)
vital_signs.oxygen_saturation: Can be low in severe cases (e.g., 85% on room air)

physical_findings: Well-demarcated erythematous lesions of varying sizes, many with pustules

lab_values.blood_culture: Positive for Listeria monocytogenes in some cases
lab_values.skin_culture: Positive for Listeria monocytogenes in some cases

risk_factors: Contact with animal products of conception
Immunocompromise (e.g., HIV, leukemia, bone marrow transplant, sarcoidosis, glucocorticoid use)

required: Isolation of Listeria monocytogenes from a normally sterile site (blood, CSF, etc.) or skin biopsy

differential_diagnoses: Other infectious diseases causing fever and skin lesions
